Experimental, for usage in research. Sets the max accumulated byte size of transactions to request in one request. Since `RLPx` protocol version 68, the byte size of a transaction is shared as metadata in a transaction announcement (see `RLPx` specs). This allows a node to request a specific size response. notice:  Enables logging for normal but significant condition

trace:   Enables logging for trace debug-level messages
extra:   Enables logging for extra debug-level messages

subcommands.description: Run a single stage. Note that this won't use the Pipeline and as a result runs stages assuming that all the data can be held in memory. It is not recommended to run a stage for really large block ranges if your computer does not have a lot of memory to store all the data.

Add a new instance of a node. Configures the ports of the node to avoid conflicts with the defaults. This is useful for running multiple nodes on the same machine. Max number of instances is 200. The path to the known peers file. Connected peers are dumped to this file on nodes shutdown, and read on startup. Cannot be used with --no-persist-peers.

Experimental, for usage in research. Sets the max accumulated byte size of transactions to request in one request. Since RLPx protocol version 68, the byte size of a transaction is shared as metadata in a transaction announcement (see RLPx specs). This allows a node to request a specific size response. By default, nodes request only 128 KiB worth of transactions, but should a peer request more, up to 2 MiB, a node will answer with more than 128 KiB.
Experimental, for usage in research. Sets the max accumulated byte size of transactions to pack in one response. Spec'd at 2MiB.
